onsider the following example:  I have to display a sorted list

b page, and I only have a functional test that verifies

is correct.  My coverage confirms that my ordering

the tests.  In this situation, the ordering

rectly tested.

y, and now I

investigate:  the HTML generation and the sorting logic.

where the bug is.

nical example
> of why peeking into private methods is not only OK, but the=

Why wouldn't this be an indic=
ation that there were insufficient 
tests? Evidently, the functional test t=
hat was supposed to make sure 
that the HTML is "correct" didn't actually v=
erify that the elements 
(whatever they are) were presented in the correct =
order. I'm not 
sure I understand what "private" means in this scenario. It=
 doesn't 
usually mean "can't directly access from a web browser URL".
